availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Corum (Greenup County, Kentucky, county and circuit clerk)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, court clerk. Virginia native. Married to Edith D. Corum. Father of Hannah S. Corum, Charles Corum, William Corum, George Corum, Edith Corum, Hance M. Corum, Edwin Corum, Hellen Corum, James Corum, and Mary Corum. Court clerk in Greenup County, Kentucky in 1850. Court clerk in Greenup County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1863,” in 1864 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 10. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 301-306.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1864,” in 1865 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1865), 9-12.
